Posts.Content: Michael: Thank you. The urologist really made light of the results. He told us that we should go home and "have a drink" and read over them. Then make an appointment to see him when he returns from vacation. However, after reading further, I have already made an appointment with another doctor at John's Hopkins.
Posts.Title: I'm lost and don't know where to even start

Posts.Content: My husband is 63. We visited the urology because of something totally unrelated. I cannot recall any PSA test being noted of suspect prior to this one. We were blindsided. Originally Posted by HighlanderCFH Hi Mrs Z, So very sorry to hear about your husband's diagnosis, but happy that Google helped you find our forum. You husband's case of prostate cancer is a very serious form of the disease. It appears that the cancer has broken through the prostate interior and is currently within the immediately surrounding tissue. A 4+4=8 is considered aggressive, so a treatment option needs to be determined in the VERY near future. The good thing is that -- if the cancer has not gone beyond the prostate & surrounding tissue -- it is STILL possible for a cure to be obtained. But time is of the essence. He probably will also be having a bone scan and abdominal CT to rule out any metastasis. His options will probably be surgery or radiation, or perhaps a combination of both. I would ask the doctor's office if there is another uro that he is associated with that can be consulted while the doctor is on vacation. That is lousy timing for him to be gone right after laying this diagnosis on you both. Keep checking the forum because there will be LOTS of comment and advice coming your way. We also often recommend getting the book, Guide to Surviving Prostate Cancer, 3rd edition, by Dr Pat Walsh. It is an older book now, but still extremely informative about prostate cancer. Can you tell us how old your husband is and his PSA history prior to the latest one of 10.29? Good luck! Chuck
Posts.Title: I'm lost and don't know where to even start

Posts.Content: So, here I am. 25 years of marriage and out of nowhere we were told Friday that my husband has prostate cancer. I found this site by GOOGLE and I need every help that I can get because this is ALL new to us. There have been no signs. Dr is now on VACATION until September 7th. His biopsy results are below. PSA: 10.29, Free PSA: 12.4 Clinical Stage : P T: 2c N X MX Grade (Gleason) : 4+4=8 Cancer found in 6/12 quadrants, additional one was precancerous Adenocarcinoma Perineural Invasion Seen: Yes Periprostatic Fat Invasion Seen: Yes Seminal Vesicle Invasion Seen: Yes A. Benign, B. Benign, C. Benign, D. Benign, E. Adenocarcinoma (7) F. Benign, G. Focus of High Grade PIN, H. Adenocarcinoma, ( I, Adenocarcinoma (7), J. Focus of Perineural Adenocarcinoma (6) K. Adenocarcinoma (7) L. Adenocarcinoma (7) Upcoming test has been scheduled for a PET.

Posts.Title: I'm lost and don't know where to even start

Posts.Content: This is my 2nd post, I wrote before that my DH's gleason was at 8, Johns Hopkins says it is a 4+5=9. We were told that it is "VERY AGRESSIVE." During our last appointment I was trying to get a glimmer of hope from the doctor. Unfortunately that was not to be had. Husband has decided on radical prostatectomy with Dr. Han at Johns Hopkins. It has been scheduled for Sept 26th. Doctor says he will be there 1 or 2 nights. As a care-giver what can I expect? How many days should I take off from work? When he returns home, will he be able to climb the stairs to get to the bedroom? Will he need assistance when he returns from the hospital? Is there anything that I should buy now that will be needed for after his surgery? What don't I know that I should? Thanks, Mrs Z
Posts.Title: And . . . here we go!
